name: Toxic Language Masking vs. Factual Core
description: Separates toxic phrasing from underlying factual claims
notes: Expect the model to mask toxicity/axiology when evaluating whether a factual statement is true.

theory.natural_language: The moderation rule masks toxicity when evaluating factual content. The sentence 'Those idiots in team Delta deployed v2 yesterday' is toxic but contains the fact 'Team Delta deployed v2 yesterday'. Toxicity should not alter the truth of the deployment fact.

queries.natural_language: Ignoring the insult, did Team Delta deploy v2 yesterday?

expected_answer.natural_language: Yes. The deployment fact stands after masking toxicity.
expected_answer.explanation: moderation_policy MASKS toxicity ∧ TeamDelta DEPLOYED v2 ∧ DATE yesterday

queries.natural_language: Does toxic wording change the factual evaluation?

expected_answer.natural_language: No. Toxicity is masked for truth evaluation.
